channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Einhorn says the market is at the fartcoin stage of the cycle. His fund bought Peloton and made these moves.
item.description: David Einhorn’s Greenlight Capital is keeping Big Tech at arm’s length, along with crypto. Here’s what the hedge fund has been buying lately.

item.title: Oil Edges Higher as Traders Weigh U.S. Tariff Risks
item.description: Crude futures returned to positive territory after opening the trading session lower as markets mull trade and tariff risks under Trump’s presidency.

item.title: Oil prices bounce as traders weigh Trump tariff threats, energy policy
item.description: Oil futures rose Wednesday, taking back some of the ground lost the previous session as investors weighed President Donald Trump’s energy policies and...

item.title: Nasdaq Futures Lead Gains
item.description: Stock futures rose on strength in the tech-heavy Nasdaq-100.

item.title: Netflix Explodes Into a New Era
item.description: The streamer ends subscriber reporting with blowout numbers and a price hike, but its record market value sets a high bar going forward.

item.title: Dollar Expected to Outperform in 2025
item.description: The DXY dollar index was weaker, however investors expected it to be the best-performing currency in 2025, according to Bank of America’s latest fund ...

item.title: Why Trump should forget about corporate tax cuts in his first 100 days
item.description: Corporate tax cuts are inflationary and could spell trouble for Republicans in the 2026 election.

item.title: J&J’s stock surrenders early gains as weak sales guidance offsets earnings beat
item.description: Medtech and drug company’s 2025 sales guidance is below consensus

item.title: How a Trump Trade War Puts Cheap Oil From Canada at Risk
item.description: The cheap Canadian oil America craves is becoming a key bargaining chip in President Trump’s threatened trade war.

item.title: The rich and famous don’t fear a stock market bubble. That’s why you should.
item.description: Elites at Davos believe ‘asset bubble bursts’ is a low risk over the next two years.
